history.content:
If you felt comfortable with the probability portion of cs70 then you will be fine. 

Stat135 assumes you are intimately familiar with common statistical topics such as mean, standard deviation, variance, covariance, random variables, and common distributions such as normal, poisson, binomial, Bernoulli and their properties. 

If you are not comfortable with the above topics, you run this risk of spending the course trying to figure out that stuff for the homework instead of understanding the high level statistical tests and concepts 135 is trying to teach. 

I would double check with the professor however, they may or may not have a hard reinforcement (I can't remember if Cal Central checked prereqs last semester with Lucas)

edit: The advantage of 134 people is that they have a semester to learn such topics, while cs70 students have half of a semester. It's up to you to decide if that was enough. 

---

It's going to be much harder with only 70 as you won't be going over topics like correlation, change of variable, and conditional distributions. If you're willing to self-study these topics it would help a lot but otherwise I'd recommend taking an additional probability course before 135

I would double check with the professor however, they may or may not have a hard reinforcement (I can't remember if Cal Central checked prereqs last semester with Lucas)

edit: The advantage of 134 people is that they have a semester to learn such topics, while cs70 students have half of a semester. It's up to you to decide if that was enough. 

---

children.subject: Lucas mentioned that moment generating functions are an important topic for the class, so you might want to self study that, which isn't hard with what you already learned in 70. But otherwise I think you will be fine.
126 would be a great replacement for 134 if not better
126 teaches concepts such as MLE, MAP, hypothesis testing, Bayesian inference, Neyman-Pearson lemma, etc. In my opinion taking 135 after 126 is slightly redundant.

I took 135 after 126, and found it to be a little redundant. However, I still found it worthwhile, since 135 covers a bunch of statistical tests (not found in 126) and presents Stats in a different way than 126.

135 w/ Lucas after 126 should a pretty light class and an easy A (provided you did well in 126).
Would EE126 be able to replace STAT 134 sufficient preparation for STAT 135?

history.content: Would CS70 be sufficient preparation for STAT135? Would I be less prepared compared to students who took STAT134?
history.subject: STAT135 with CS70 and without STAT134
